sentences: Mina ja naabrid k√§isime koos poodi.
context: The word 'naabrid' is the plural form of 'naaber' in Estonian. It refers to people who live near you, specifically your neighbors or next-door neighbors. In the example from the dictionary, 'naabrirahvast' means 'from among the neighbors/people nearby'. This word is commonly used when referring to multiple people living in proximity to each other.
